verbose_text: The IR in transgenic mice expressing the HCV core, associated with high serum concentrations of TNF-alpha, can be reverted by anti-TNF-alpha antibodies [XREF_BIBR], implying that HCV core expressing hepatocytes secrete TNF-alpha, which may then induce IR via serine phosphorylation of IRS-1.
evidence: TNF-alpha, which may then induce IR via serine phosphorylation of IRS-1
